W. Kerr Scott
Governor
STATE OP NORTH CAROLINA
Governor’s Office
Raleigh
October 21* 1952
Mr. Frank E* Schooley, Treasurer
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
Office of Executive Director
University of Illinois
119 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Mr. Schooley:
I have had the opportunity of closely observing
the activities of Mr. Earl Wynn for the past four years.
My observations lead me to recommend him very
highly for any position Involving educational technique
development and promotion, particularly In the fields of radio
and television.
In addition to his outstanding leadership In
the work and administration of the Communication Center of the
University of North Carolina, Mr. Wynn has made a major contribu¬
tion to education in North Carolina through his direction of the
studies of the North Carolina Communication Commission In the
field of audio-visual aids in educational processes.
His warm personality, his sound imagination, and
proved administrative ability make him a valuable citizen of our
State and staff member of the University of North Carolina.
WKS:blc
Sincerely,
/s/ W. Kerr Scott
